intro: Sonnea hispida, commonly known as the hispid sonnea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sonnea hispida is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
